You aren't open for a discussion judging by the way you reply to the critical comments, so I'll explain in detail why it's probably the WORST AD item he can get.

BotRK: Deals 6% of the targets current health in physical damage, and the active deals 10% of the target's maximum HP in Physical damage, heals for that amount, and steals 25% movement speed. Let's do the calculations on a target with 3000 HP, and no Armor. We'll use a champion who often builds BotRK, like Vayne, as an example. We'll give her 2.0 attack speed for calculations' sake, even though some of her builds take her past the 2.0 mark.

Target: 3000 HP and zero Armor

Elapsed Time: 10 seconds

Jhin AS rounded, at lv 18: 0.95

Vayne AS: 2.0



Here comes the math.



Vayne: 6%/s ---> 2.0AS = 12%/s = 120%/10s ---> 1.2Ã—3000 = 3600 HP dmg dealt over 10 seconds

Jhin: 6%/s ---> .95AS = 5.7%/s = 57%/10s ---> .57x3000 = 1710 HP dmg dealt over 10 seconds



So, not only does Jhin get less than HALF of the effectiveness from the item as someone who can build Attack Speed, but I'm being generous here. I didn't count reload time, I didn't count the time it takes for Jhin to W, drop traps, Q, etc. Vayne's abilities weave into her attack speed much more smoothly, and she also has a passive to synergize with BotRK. Under non-ideal conditions, Jhin would likely get 1/3 or 1/4 the usage of BotRK that any AS-building champion would.




Tl;dr: OP is stupid and doesn't know how to math, nor can he even gauge a ballpark estimate, because he somehow manages to think that even theoretically this could work on Jhin.

Alright, Number crunch time.

With that build, using scimitar, Jhin would have 597 AD at 18

Using the most common build, with no Bork, Jhin would have 678 AD and 30 Armor pen

The proc from Bork would need to match 81 damage, considering armor pen, it would need to match 105 damage, so the target would need to have more than 1759 current health.

Because of the armor pen, if the target has armor, then the gap becomes even larger where tanks (which are the one's most likely to have current health values that high), become too resistant to the %health physical damage.

So basically, because you don't have enough damage from the proc to match the raw damage and arp you could have otherwise, then you can't kill tanks as well, you can't kill squishies as well, and you sacrifice early ARP powerspikes for it.

Doesn't look good.
